perturbation.original_text: A. "Contract Period" shall mean that period of time of three (3) years commencing on November 1st, 2017 and concluding November 2nd, 2020, unless terminated sooner or extended as provided in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: A. "Contract Period" shall mean that period of time of three (3) years commencing on November 1st, 2017 and concluding November 2nd, 2020. The contract period is subject to change based on Company performance.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a fixed contract period. The modified text introduces ambiguity by stating the period is "subject to change based on Company performance," which contradicts the initial fixed definition. This creates uncertainty about the contract's duration.

perturbation.original_text: SECTION FOUR. REMUNERATION   In consideration of the endorsement rights granted under this Agreement, Company shall provide the following remuneration:   A. An initial one-time license fee of $35,000.00USD (Thirty-Five Thousand Dollars) payable to the NFLA-NC;    B. A one-time $10,000USD (Ten Thousand Dollars) promotional fee payable to NFLA. The $10,000 promotional fee shall be payable in four (4) quarterly payments beginning in 2018: Q1 ($2500); Q2 ($2500); Q3 ($2500); Q4 ($2500). Each payment shall be delivered by no later than the 10t h day of the first month of each quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: SECTION FOUR. REMUNERATION   In consideration of the endorsement rights granted under this Agreement, Company shall provide the following remuneration:   A. An initial one-time license fee of $35,000.00USD (Thirty-Five Thousand Dollars) payable to the NFLA-NC;    B. A one-time $10,000USD (Ten Thousand Dollars) promotional fee payable to NFLA. The $10,000 promotional fee may be payable in quarterly payments if company assets are low.
perturbation.explanation: Original text specifies a one-time fee payable in set quarterly installments. The modified version introduces a conditional clause "may be payable in quarterly payments if company assets are low." which directly contradicts the original guarantee of quarterly installment payments. This changes the payment conditions from a requirement to a discretionary option depending on the company's financial situation. This would cause financial disputes with the NFLA.

perturbation.original_text: SECTION THREE. PRIOR APPROVAL   Company agrees that no use of the name of the NFLA Identification nor any item used in connection with the name of NFLA Identification (including any Licensed Product) will be made under this Agreement unless and until the same is approved by the NFLA. The NFLA agrees that any material, advertising or otherwise, submitted for approval as provided in this section may be deemed by Company to have been approved under this section if the same is not disapproved in writing within ten (10) business days after receipt of the material.
perturbation.changed_text: SECTION THREE. PRIOR APPROVAL   Company agrees that no use of the name of the NFLA Identification nor any item used in connection with the name of NFLA Identification (including any Licensed Product) will be made under this Agreement unless and until the same is approved by the NFLA. The NFLA can approve items at their discretion. The NFLA agrees that any material, advertising or otherwise, submitted for approval as provided in this section may be deemed by Company to have been approved under this section if the same is not disapproved in writing within thirty (30) business days after receipt of the material.
perturbation.explanation: Original text specifies a 10 business day deadline for the NFLA to provide feedback on marketing material. The modified version changes it to 30 business days. It also states that NFLA can approve items at their discretion. This severely impacts the company's marketing operations and causes uncertainty on the approval timeframes.
